thread.title: Manorama was known for her singing, too
thread.title_full: Manorama was known for her singing, too - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Manorama was known for her singing, too
text:
She might have given the protagonists of her day a tough competition with her flair for acting, but Aachi Manorama also impressed many as a singer. Aachi began her singing career with the film Magale Un Samathu. The song was composed by GK Venkatesh and Manorama sang along with the veteran singer LR Eswari. The lines go like this- 'Thaatha thaatha pidi kudu... Indha thalladha vayasila sadugudu....'
However, the song that put her in the spotlight was Vaa Vaathiyaare in Bommalattam composed by V Kumar. Manorama then went on to sing for MS Vishwanathan, Ilaiyaraaja and even AR Rahman. Her song Madrasa Suthi in May Madham was a chartbuster. Some of her songs include- Vaa Vaathiya, Dillikku Rajanaalum, Theriyatho Nokku Theriyatho and Madrasa Suthi.
